ConceptMap0..*ConceptMapLIVDConceptMap
urlS0..1uriLogical URI to reference this concept map (globally unique)
identifier0..0
version0..0
nameS1..1stringName for this concept map (computer friendly)
title0..0
statusS1..1codedraft | active | retired | unknown
experimental0..0
date0..0
publisher0..0
contact0..0
description0..0
useContext0..0
jurisdiction0..0
purpose0..0
copyright0..0
source[x]S1..1uri, canonical(ValueSet)Identifies the source of the concepts which are being mapped
target[x]S1..1uri, canonical(ValueSet)Provides context to the mappings
groupS1..1BackboneElementSame source and target systems
source0..0
sourceVersion0..0
target0..0
targetVersion0..0
elementS1..*BackboneElementMappings for a Vendor Analyte Code from the source set
codeS1..1codeIdentifies the Vendor Analyte Code being mapped
displayS1..1stringThe Vendor Analyte Name
targetS0..*BackboneElementIdentifies the LOINC code being mapped to
codeS1..1codeCode that identifies the LOINC Code
displayS1..1stringLOINC Long Name
equivalenceS1..1coderelatedto | equivalent | equal | wider | subsumes | narrower | specializes | inexact | unmatched | disjoint
commentS0..1stringVendor Comment
dependsOnSI2..3(Slice Definition)Other elements required for this mapping (from context)
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:property
livd-1: If the dependsOn is valued, either the code or display must be present
dependsOn:specimenS1..1BackboneElementThe property for specimen
propertyS1..1uriReference to property mapping depends on
Fixed Value: specimen
system0..0
valueS1..1stringValue of the specimen property
display0..0
dependsOn:resultS1..1BackboneElementThe property for result
propertyS1..1uriReference to property mapping depends on
Fixed Value: result
system0..0
valueS1..1stringValue of the result property
display0..0
dependsOn:otherS0..1BackboneElementThe property for result
propertyS1..1uriReference to property mapping depends on
Fixed Value: other
system0..0
valueS1..1stringValue of the result property
display0..0
product0..0
unmapped0..0

Documentation for this format

name: LIVDConceptMap
title: LIVDConceptMap
publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations Work Group
description: Explanation of what this profile contains/is for

element.short: Logical URI to reference this concept map (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this concept map when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this concept map is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the concept map. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
element.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid:, but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same url if they have a distinct.
Only "Active" must be supported as it reflects the time of publication.  Others are not valid for that.
& Frequently, the copyright differs between the concept map, and codes that are included. The copyright statement should clearly differentiate between these when required.

element.short: Identifies the source of the concepts which are being mapped
element.definition: The source value set that specifies the concepts that are being mapped.
element.comment: This points to the device for which the IVD Test Codes are mapped to the suggested LOINC codes.

element.definition: The target value set provides context to the mappings. Note that the mapping is made between concepts, not between value sets, but the value set provides important context about how the concept mapping choices are made.
element.comment: This points to the LIVDLOINCCodeSystemProfile that contains the LOINC codes and their properties, used to map the  IVD Test Codes.
Considering the scope is only IVD Test Code to LOINC, one group is sufficient.

element.definition: An absolute URI that identifies the Code System for the Vendor Analyte Codes.
The specific version of the code system, as determined by the manufacturer.
An absolute URI that identifies the code system for the LOINC codes referenced.
element.comment: Target may be omitted if all the target element equivalence values are 'unmatched'.

element.definition: The specific version of the code system, as established by the manufacturer for this publication.

element.short: Mappings for a Vendor Analyte Code from the source set
element.definition: Mappings for an individual Vendor Analyte Code in the source to one or more LOINC Codes in the target.
element.comment: Generally an Vendor Analyte Code points to one or more LOINC Codes, but it is possible that a LOINC Code does not exist yet.

element.short: Identifies the Vendor Analyte Code being mapped
element.definition: Identity (code or path) of the Vendor Analyte Code being mapped.
The Vendor Analyte Name for the Vendore Analyte Code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.

element.short: Identifies the LOINC code being mapped to
element.definition: A reference to the LOINC code being mapped to, including mapping criteria.

element.short: Code that identifies the LOINC Code
element.definition: Identity (code or path) the LOINC Code that the map refers to.
The LOINC Long Name for the LOINC code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.
A description of status, issues, or other mapping criteria in mapping that conveys additional information not represented in  the structured data.
element.comment: This provides the ability for the vendor for additional human readable clarifications to the Laboratory on how to consider mapping IVD Test Codes to LOINC codes beyond the Result and Specimen descriptions in the dependsOn construct.

Either .code or .display must be valued.
There must be both a specimen and result related description.

constraint.human: If the dependsOn is valued, either the code or display must be present

element.definition: This provides the coded representation of the description for the Specimen description.
element.comment: This human readable description provides further information for use by the Lab staff to finalize the appropriate mapping of the analyte test code to the LOINC code for the specific device and purpose within that Lab.

element.definition: This represents the vendor description for the Specimen description.

A reference to an element that holds a coded value that corresponds to a code system property. The idea is that the information model carries an element somwhere that is labeled to correspond with a code system property.
element.comment: This references the list of characteristics, e.g., Specimen or Result, for which further clarifying descriptions are provided.

element.definition: This provides the coded representation of the description for the Result description.
element.comment: This human readable description provides further information for use by the Lab staff to finalize the appropriate mapping of the analyte test code to the LOINC code for the specific device and purpose within that Lab.

element.definition: This represents the vendor description for the Result description.

A reference to an element that holds a coded value that corresponds to a code system property. The idea is that the information model carries an element somwhere that is labeled to correspond with a code system property.
element.comment: This references the list of characteristics, e.g., Specimen or Result, for which further clarifying descriptions are provided.

element.definition: This provides the coded representation of the description for an additional dependency (not Specimen or Result) description.
element.comment: This human readable description provides further information for use by the Lab staff to finalize the appropriate mapping of the analyte test code to the LOINC code for the specific device and purpose within that Lab.

element.definition: This represents the vendor description for an additional dependency (not Specimen or Result) description.

element.short: When no match in the mappings
element.definition: What to do when there is no match in the mappings in the group.
element.comment: This only applies if the source code is in the system defined for the group.

element.definition: Defines which action to take if there is no match in the group. One of 3 actions is possible: use the unmapped code (this is useful when doing a mapping between versions, and only a few codes have changed), use a fixed code (a default code), or alternatively, a reference to a different concept map can be provided (by canonical URL).

element.short: Canonical URL for other concept map
element.definition: The canonical URL of the map to use if this map contains no mapping.
